title: Czech Republic vs England, Euro 2020 qualification: live score and latest updates
text:
England will be on the brink of Euro 2020 qualification tonight with victory against Czech Republic, but Gareth Southgate will want to see signs of a tighter defensive unit after two loose performances against Bulgaria and Kosovo in September.

There seems to be a dearth of quality among the central European nations just now, and this Czech side is a pale imitation of those containing names such as Panenka, Porborsky, Nedved, Koller, Rosicky, Baros and Cech.

England should look to dominate possession even away from home, and Southgate switched to 4-3-3 after the World Cup with a view to controlling matches with greater authority.

They also have a wealth of attacking talent to squeeze in, so a roving front three makes sense. Raheem Sterling, Marcus Rashford and Harry Kane are the incumbents and have Southgate's trust but you could argue Tammy Abraham and Jadon Sancho are more deserving of starts on current form.

That said, Southgate is trying to create a culture where England starts are earned rather than handed out as a pat on the back.

John Stones is out injured and Joe Gomez is slightly off colour, so it could be a central defensive partnership of Harry Maguire and Michael Keane which does not look the most convincing nor complimentary.

England's other long-standing problem has been a lack of technical assurance and creativity in midfield, but James Maddison and Mason Mount look exactly what they need in this area. In fact, the pair have pushed Dele Alli down the pecking order with their performances.

Asked what had impressed him about Mount, Southgate said: “Exactly what I thought of him when I saw him playing for our Under-16s. He’s a quality player, an intelligent footballer, presses well, has a real eye for goal, good quality. So, nothing I’ve seen surprises me at all.

Team news on the way shortly.
